title: Data-Driven Room Acoustic Modeling Via Differentiable Feedback Delay Networks With Learnable Delay Lines
abstract: arXiv:2404.00082v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Over the past few decades, extensive research has been devoted to the design of artificial reverberation algorithms aimed at emulating the room acoustics of physical environments. Despite significant advancements, automatic parameter tuning of delay-network models remains an open challenge. We introduce a novel method for finding the parameters of a Feedback Delay Network (FDN) such that its output renders the perceptual qualities of a measured room impulse response. The proposed approach involves the implementation of a differentiable FDN with trainable delay lines, which, for the first time, allows us to simultaneously learn each and every delay-network parameter via backpropagation. The iterative optimization process seeks to minimize a time-domain loss function incorporating differentiable terms accounting for energy decay and echo density. translated_title: 基于可微分反馈延迟网络和可学习延迟线的数据驱动室内声学建模
translated_abstract: 在过去的几十年中，人们致力于设计人工混响算法，旨在模拟物理环境的室内声学。尽管取得了显著进展，但延迟网络模型的自动参数调整仍然是一个开放性挑战。我们提出了一种新方法，通过学习可微分反馈延迟网络（FDN）的参数，使其输出呈现出所测得的室内脉冲响应的感知特性。
tldr: 通过可学习延迟线实现可微分反馈延迟网络的参数优化，实现了对室内声学特性的数据驱动建模。
en_tdlr: Parameter optimization of Feedback Delay Networks for room acoustic modeling is achieved by learning with trainable delay lines, enabling data-driven modeling of room acoustics.
